content.question: Let f be a function with <math><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVCI8FfYJH8YrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbb a9q8WqFfeaY=biLkVcLq=JHqpepeea0=as0Fb9pgeaYRXxe9vr0=vr 0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaabaaaaaaaaape GaamOza8aadaqadaqaa8qacaaIWaaapaGaayjkaiaawMcaa8qacaqG GaGaeyypa0Jaaeiiaiaaigdaaaa@3C7E@</annotation></semantics></math> , <math><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>'</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>2</mn></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVCI8FfYJH8YrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbb a9q8WqFfeaY=biLkVcLq=JHqpepeea0=as0Fb9pgeaYRXxe9vr0=vr 0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaabaaaaaaaaape GaamOzaiaacEcapaWaaeWaaeaapeGaaGimaaWdaiaawIcacaGLPaaa peGaaeiiaiabg2da9iaabccacaaIYaaaaa@3D2A@</annotation></semantics></math> , and <math><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>"</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext> </mtext><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVCI8FfYJH8YrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbb a9q8WqFfeaY=biLkVcLq=JHqpepeea0=as0Fb9pgeaYRXxe9vr0=vr 0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaabaaaaaaaaape GaamOzaiaackcapaWaaeWaaeaapeGaaGimaaWdaiaawIcacaGLPaaa peGaaeiiaiabg2da9iaabccacqGHsislcaaIYaaaaa@3E12@</annotation></semantics></math> . Which of the following could be the graph of the second-degree Taylor polynomial for f about <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>0</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVCI8FfYJH8YrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbb a9q8WqFfeaY=biLkVcLq=JHqpepeea0=as0Fb9pgeaYRXxe9vr0=vr 0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaabaaaaaaaaape GaamiEaiabg2da9iaabccacaaIWaaaaa@396B@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated along the x axis. The number 1 is indicated on the y axis. The curve begins in quadrant 3 far below the x axis at x equals negative 1. It moves steeply upward and to the right, crossing the x axis to the left of the origin, and crossing the y axis at 1. The curve begins to level off just to the right of the y axis and reaches a maximum. It then turns downward and to the right, crossing the x axis just to the left of 1, and ends in quadrant 4, just below the x axis at x equals 1.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated along the x axis. The number 1 is indicated on the y axis. The curve begins in quadrant 3 below the x axis at x equals negative 1. It moves gradually upward and to the right, crossing the x axis to the left of the origin, and crossing the y axis at 1. The curve begins to level off just to the right of the y axis and reaches a maximum at approximately 1 comma 2, where it ends.

The figure presents a graph of a line in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated along the x axis. The number 1 is indicated on the y axis. The line begins in quadrant 3 just below the x axis at x equals negative 1. It moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis about halfway between negative 1 and the origin, and crossing the y axis at 1. The line continues upward and to the right until it ends at the point with coordinates 1 comma 3.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated along the x axis. The number 1 is indicated on the y axis. The curve begins in quadrant 2 above the x axis at x equals negative 1. It moves downward and to the right, initially, before reaching a minimum just above the x axis about halfway between negative 1 and the origin. It then turns upward and to the right, crossing the y axis at 1, and ends in quadrant 1, high above the x axis at the point with coordinates 1 comma 5.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 1 and 1 are indicated along the x axis. The number 1 is indicated on the y axis. The curve begins in quadrant 3 below the x axis at x equals negative 1. It moves gradually upward and to the right, crossing the x axis to the left of the origin, and crossing the y axis at 1. The curve begins to level off just to the right of the y axis and reaches a maximum at approximately 1 comma 2, where it ends.

topic.text: 10.11: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor Polynomial Approximations of Functions
